text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Political parties and social organisations back constitutional reforms.
- British national Derek Russel Powell was arrested in the Moroccan port of Tangier on a charge of smuggling drugs.
- South Korean group Daewoo and Moroccan construction federation held talks over partnership construction projects.
- Tunisia and Morocco set joint committees to boost bilateral cooperation. Tunisian Prime Minister Hamed Karoui visited Morocco this week.
- King Hassan met visiting Tunisian Prime Minister Hamed Karoui.
- National federation of petrol station operators cancels strike planned for September 23.
- Istiqlal party says vote 'Yes' for constitutional reforms on September 13.
- NATO naval force visit Morocco on September 12.
